intro: Calyptranthes rigida, commonly known as the rigid calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Calyptranthes rigida is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
